Technique: BURNED, OXIDIZED; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Vase
Description: Truncate cone-shaped vase with wide mouth and pointed rim. The walls are straight and the vase has a stable base with a concave bottom. Paste of an orangey colour and interior and exterior surface covered with a reddish-coloured coating. The upper third presents a band of barely marked grooves. On the rim, both inner and outer, we find a narrow band of a reddish colour encircling the piece.
